newsitem.title: FRANCE: Salomon sees 10 pct rise in 96/97 sales.
newsitem.headline: Salomon sees 10 pct rise in 96/97 sales.

text.p: Sports equipment maker Salomon said it expected sales to rise around 10 percent in 1996/97 and net profit as a percentage of sales to be steady.
A statement by the company quoted chairman Jean-Francois Gautier as saying strong business in the summer sports equipment "should allow a new sales rise on the order of 10 percent."
"The rise of costs linked to diversification, more than 60 million francs, will weigh on the net result. It should be stable as a percentage of sales," he said.
